Pre-Game Insights: Gernot Rohr could inflict even more misery on his old side when his current one host the three-time African champions on Monday.

The upshot of Benin's win over Rwanda leaves them level with the side they defeated and one behind table-topping Lesotho, who got the better of bottom Zimbabwe in round three, meaning first and bottom in Group C are separated by three points.
Having played a day earlier than Nigeria, the Cheetahs hope to be beneficiaries of the extra day's rest, keen to end the Super Eagles' undefeated start to qualifying.
Team News: Dokou Dodo was the match-winner against Rwanda, and the midfield man should retain his place for Monday's match.
Benin's main threat remains Steve Mounie, and the centre-forward should lead the attack with Junior Olaitan and Jodel Dossou flanking the striker.
Nigeria were not quite fortunate, with the admirable Dele-Bashiru replaced moments after he was clumsily brought down in the penalty area and George conforming Semi Ajayi was withdrawn with a knock.
